comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_1) AppleWebKit/534.48.3 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.1 Safari/534.48.3

Steps to reproduce:

Using Mac OS X 10.7.1, and Firefox 8.0.1 or Nightly 11.0a1 (2011-12-08): opened a page which contained an iFrame whose window.onload contained a function telling that iFrame to print. Example: http://jsfiddle.net/WZh3V/



Actual results:

Print dialog box appears, however clicking "print" results in no action; clicking "PDF > Save As PDF…" produces a zero-byte PDF file.


Expected results:

Print dialog box should appear and clicking "Print" should result in document being sent to the print spooler. Click "PDF > Save as PDF…" should save the PDF, not produce a zero-byte file. Correct behavior is seen on Mac OS X 10.5 and Mac OS X 10.6. Correct behavior is seen under Mac OS X 10.7 using Safari or Chrome.
comments.text:
Created attachment 580222
- jsFiddle demo.pdf

Using Mac OS X 10.7.1, and Firefox 8.0.1 or Nightly 11.0a1 (2011-12-08): opened a page which contained an iFrame whose window.onload contained a function telling that iFrame to print. Example: http://jsfiddle.net/WZh3V/



Actual results:

Print dialog box appears, however clicking "print" results in no action; clicking "PDF > Save As PDF…" produces a zero-byte PDF file.


Expected results:

Print dialog box should appear and clicking "Print" should result in document being sent to the print spooler. Click "PDF > Save as PDF…" should save the PDF, not produce a zero-byte file. Correct behavior is seen on Mac OS X 10.5 and Mac OS X 10.6. Correct behavior is seen under Mac OS X 10.7 using Safari or Chrome.

comments.text:
Also, using Firefox 8.0.1, clicking the "Print" link in the demo results in a modal dialog box "Printer Not Available". Same thing happens when right clicking and choosing "This Frame > Print frame". *This* behavior is not reproducible in Nightly, only in 8.0.1.

Attaching screenshot of this issue.
comments.creator: mozillabugzilla@josh.gitlin.name
